subtitle: New Thinking Allowed
Conversations on the leading edge of knowledge and discovery with parapsychologist Jeffrey Mishlove.
Hello and welcome. I’m Jeffrey Mishlove. Today I’d like to talk about non-duality.
The simplest idea that there is, basically: all is one.
It's probably also the most profound
idea that there is. In a way I’m surprised that,
after 172 “In Presence” dialogues,
I haven’t brought this one up yet, at least as a special topic. But it is implicit
actually in practically all of the other dialogues, all of the other monologues.
Even going back to the early 1970s when I began first doing interviews on the radio,
I would tell people when they asked, “What are your best programs?”
I would say, “The best programs are always the ones that end on that note,
of the oneness of everything.” As a parapsychologist,
I have to tell you, the oneness of everything
is the most simple explanation. How is ESP possible? Because all is connected.
Everything is interrelated, all is one.
I don’t know any other way to really explain it.
There’s no real evidence for any sort of signal transmission that can explain
extrasensory perception. There’s no evidence for any sort of energetic
transmission to explain psychokinesis, particularly
psychokinesis at a distance.
Now, the problem is that we live in a world of duality.
We live in a world where the very
idea that all is one seems to be an anathema. I hear from
viewers all the time who struggle with this, who have trouble with it. The trouble is very
disturbing too because
it usually means that there’s an Other, that there’s some kind of otherness out there and that otherness is
evil. That otherness is trying to control you. That otherness is trying to make you into a robot,
or make you into a consumer, or to keep you from
experiencing your own unique selfhood, your own unique separateness, your destiny,
your purpose in life. It’s a paradox.
But when you expect that the otherness out there is evil,
that is – I have to tell you – 100% of the time a projection.
I know there are many of you that are going to not like that. There are some of you who are absolutely
convinced. I read about it all the time in the comments: bankers are evil, especially Jewish bankers of course. Or,
doctors are evil. The doctors are now trying to
scare us into believing that there's this terrible virus out there so that they can make more money.
Or, it’s the Catholics who are evil, the Pope is trying to control everything.
I find – it would be funnier if it weren’t for my own Jewish upbringing –
the fact that when Jews were
identified as the evil one, it led to horrible,
tragic circumstances for the Jews. So,
shouldn’t I therefore acknowledge that the Nazis are the evil ones?
You might think so. But no, I don’t,
because all is one. And that means,
frankly, that I am one with Adolf Hilter.
I know that sounds pretty incongruous, hard to believe it. We live in a world of paradoxes,
that’s for sure.
You could say that what’s really going on in this world is a great big game of hide and seek. You
know, children all over the world in every culture play hide and seek.
You might say that’s what we’re doing, that’s what God is doing with himself/herself/itself.
So, sure, it seems ludicrous for me to tell you that I am one with the universe. I am God.
Well then, how come I don’t just end all wars? How come I don’t just
demonstrate it by
levitating or flying to Mars and back? I
wish I could but
there are many subtleties
involved. This is a very ancient philosophy. Of course,
non-dualism, Advaita Vedanta, can be traced back to Shankara in the 8th century in India.
But, I find it in the idea of monotheism.
Every Jewish person knows the prayer: “Hero is real. The Lord our God. The Lord is One.”
What does that mean? The Lord is One. There are nuances, as I mentioned earlier.
For example, I could say that I partake of God. That,
in the very depths of my soul,
there is God. It doesn’t mean that I, at the ego level, am God. No, of course not. At the ego level, I am
encapsulated in my skin and I am responsible for this body, for sure. But at a different level of my psyche
altogether,
we’re well beyond the ego, way, way beyond the ego. This is why altered states of consciousness, this is why
mysticism – mystical states – are so important. One enters into a level of consciousness where the ego
goes away, dissolves, takes a temporary vacation. Then one gets a glimpse of
the ultimate unity. Another way to express it,
I suppose, is that every time we take a breath of air we are breathing in
molecules that were breathed in by every other animal, every other person who ever lived with each breath,
including Hitler. Every time I breath in I am breathing a
molecule of air that was breathed by Hitler. So, for those of you who
have enemies, who believe you have enemies, who believe that this is an unfriendly world:
How can it be an unfriendly world if all is one? I
know that, for some of you,
circumstances are tragic. There’s no doubt about it. We can look around and
if we have an open heart we have no choice
but to feel compassion for all the suffering in the world. We have no choice but to feel a sense of
empathy for the oppressed of the world. I,
for one, grew up with a strong streak of what some people – my dear friend
Jason likes to call,
disparagingly actually – social justice warriors. I believe strongly in social justice warriors. But I don’t believe in
labels. Especially I don’t believe in labelling anyone as evil,
diabolic, satanic or whatever the
intention is to make them so “other” that they can be treated in
an inhumane way. I
know I’ve said this before too, if with regard to alien beings,
monsters from outer space, we’re one with them all.
Demons, we’re one with them. Angels, we’re one with them.
Or, should I say God is one with them and God is one with us.
Or, if you prefer to
think of it in atheistic terms, you can too. The overwhelming
empty spacious nothingness of nirvana is also one with
everything. In quantum physics terms its entanglement.
Particles, the whole universe, is entangled.
Everything is instantly, immediately connected with everything else.
That is, to my understanding, the
fundamental explanation for all of
parapsychology. It may be a little too simple to satisfy everybody,
but that’s the bedrock right there. There are many nuances – as I have said - to be worked out.
Of course there are. We’re not going to do away with all philosophy and all psychology simply by saying, “All is one.”
But, if you don’t recognise the
oneness of everything, then you have missed out on the most important lesson of kindergarten.
It should be the lesson that serves as the foundation for everything else you know and understand.
That’s my message.
You may take it or leave it.
But that’s definitely my message.
People ask me, “What is it you want to communicate to the world?” That is it. I
know it's not easy to integrate, and so I’ll leave you with this thought:
How are you doing with the oneness in your life? When do you enter into states of extreme
alienation, extreme despair? I know some of you do because you post:
extreme grief, extreme anger, extreme hatred.
All of those
emotions – the darker human emotions – are expressions of that same oneness.
They are. It fills me, to be honest, with a strong
sense that I have the answer to the question that Einstein once said is the most important question
anybody can ask: Is the universe
friendly? Of course it's friendly.
It fills me with great joy.
People wonder why I smile and laugh so much. Well, it's
because of my grounding in that fundamental
mysticism. It's not as if I’ve ever had some sort of mystical experience.
I don’t talk to angels like some people do. I don’t have
spirit guides like some people do. I don’t see auras like some people do. But I have somehow
managed – and I think, to be honest, largely through the process of study and
understanding, through what you might call Yana Yoga, the Yoga of Knowledge, or Gnosis –
I have come to this awareness: All Is One. So, I am not concerned about
diabolical influences. I am not concerned about archons.
I am not concerned about evil deities of any kind. I
am not concerned about people who hate me. I
embrace the universe in its fullness.
I suggest that you can too.
I’ll leave you with that thought and that question for you to ponder.
Can you?
Thank you so much for being with me.
